meanings.definition: The action of ending a policy of racial segregation.
meanings.sent1: The desegregations in schools allowed children of all races to learn together.
meanings.sent2: After the desegregations, people of different races could sit together on buses.
meanings.sent3: The desegregations at the park made it more fun for everyone to play together.
meanings.sent4: Her speech about desegregations was a beacon of hope for a more inclusive society.
meanings.sent5: The desegregations brought a wave of unity and understanding among the community.

meanings.definition: The process of integrating previously segregated facilities or institutions.
meanings.sent1: The desegregations of the water fountains allowed everyone to drink from the same source.
meanings.sent2: During the desegregations, public places became more welcoming to all.
meanings.sent3: The desegregations of the library made it easier for everyone to access books.
meanings.sent4: The desegregations of the workplace led to a more diverse and inclusive environment.
meanings.sent5: The desegregations of the neighborhood brought people together in new ways.
